meanings.sent1: Carrying the hurden of responsibility can be challenging.
meanings.sent2: The worker struggled under the weight of the hurden on his back.
meanings.sent3: The hurden of carrying all the groceries made her arms ache.
meanings.sent4: The hurden of guilt weighed heavily on his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The hurden of grief felt like a boulder on her chest.

meanings.definition: To load or burden with a heavy weight.
meanings.sent1: He had to hurden the cart with bricks for the construction.
meanings.sent2: She would hurden herself with books before heading to the library.
meanings.sent3: I will hurden you with so many gifts, you won't be able to carry them all!
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to hurden the sky with impending rain.
meanings.sent5: The coach would hurden the players with intense training sessions.

meanings.definition: To weigh down or oppress with a heavy load.
meanings.sent1: The worries of the world hurdened her heart.
meanings.sent2: The debt would hurden him with stress and anxiety.
meanings.sent3: Don't hurden yourself with unnecessary tasks; take a break!
meanings.sent4: The sadness seemed to hurden the room with a heavy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The past mistakes hurdened his mind, making it hard to focus.
